intro: Impatiens komarovii, commonly known as Komarov's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
